channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 52 Bins Rubbish and faeces on path, 9th December
item.description:
Address 52 continously leave bins and rubbish on path. Faeces can be seen in picture. Food waste attracting vermin and flies etc. Last report closed and said is was completed and it was not. Fine needs issued and path needs clearing and cleaned.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barrier, 9th December
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 08/12/25 02:54 Dear Bromley There has been a dumped barricade on Clifford Avenue near the junction with Denbigh Close Chislehurst for several weeks blocking the pavement - please can you take it away asap? Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clifford Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Pavements near the footbridge from Buckingham Avenue needs cleaning asap, 9th December
item.description:
Pavements near the footbridge from Buckingham Avenue needs cleaning asap - they have not been cleaned for a couple years now and the pavements are awful and rubbish blows everywhere. Please can this be looked into asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in burnt out garage, 9th December
item.description:
In the council garage between kirkham street and ravine grove SE18 there is a burnt out garage that is filled with rubbish and now people think they can fly tip there . There is no roof or doors on this building
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ravine Grove, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bulky household rubbish dumped BESIDE council roadside bin, 9th December
item.description:
Rubbish appeared overnight. There is a chair, a laundry rack and a ripped bag of household waste which is strewn over the pavement. Also a bag and pizza boxes are blowing around the street from this dumped rubbish. Please could the council come and clear it away? Unfortunately this happens a lot at this bin.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrewsbury Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Seemingly endless weekly occurence of flytipping all sorts of things by the lampost, 9th December
item.description:
